meanings.definition: To coat or treat with cosmoline to prevent rust or corrosion.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic cosmolined the metal parts to keep them from rusting.
meanings.sent2: It is important to cosmoine metal tools to protect them from rust.
meanings.sent3: The bicycle was cosmolined so well that even the rain couldn't make it rusty.
meanings.sent4: She cosmolined her thoughts with positivity to prevent any negativity from corroding her mind.
meanings.sent5: The old car was cosmolined so thoroughly that it looked as good as new.

meanings.sent1: The cosmolined rifle gleamed in the sunlight, well-protected from rust.
meanings.sent2: The cosmolined machinery in the warehouse stayed in perfect condition.
meanings.sent3: The cosmolined picnic basket kept the sandwiches fresh and rust-free.
meanings.sent4: Her cosmolined skin glistened with a protective layer against the harsh elements.
meanings.sent5: The cosmolined gears in the clock ensured smooth operation without any corrosion.
